greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: coefficients of Fermat-Lucas polynomials.
comment: The Fermat-Lucas polynomials F(n) are defined by the recurrence: F(0) = 2, F(1) = 3*y and F(n) = 3*y*F(n - 1) - 2*F(n - 2) for n > 1. - _Andrew Howroyd_, Aug 20 2018
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1274
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Fermat-Lucas Polynomial.
mathematica: << Lucas`; Table[ExpandAll[Fermatf[n, x]], {n, 0, 10}]; a = Table[CoefficientList[Fermatf[n, x], x], {n, 0, 10}]; Flatten[a] Table[Apply[Plus, CoefficientList[Fermatf[n, x], x]], {n, 0, 10}]
program: (PARI) T(n,k)=polcoef(polcoef((2 - 3*x*y)/(1 - 3*y*x + 2*x^2) + O(x*x^n), n, x), k, y);
for(n=0, 10, for(k=0, n, print1(T(n, k), ", ")); print); \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, Aug 20 2018
results.author: _Roger L. Bagula_, Apr 09 2008
ext: Offset corrected and name clarified by _Andrew Howroyd_, Aug 20 2018
